action.action-desc: Mr. Gibbs (for himself and Mr. Curtis) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform, and in addition to the Committees on House Administration, and the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 to modify the timing to file periodic transaction reports, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transparency in Government Officials Trading Act.

section.header: Modification of timing for periodic transaction reports

subsection.text: Section 103(l) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App. 103(l)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 30 days after receiving notification of any transaction and inserting 24 hours after conducting any transaction;
by striking , but in no case later than 45 days after such transaction; and

subsection.text: Section 104(d) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App. 104(d)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

Any individual who, as determined by the supervising ethics office, fails to file a report under section 103(l) within 24 hours of the date such report is required to be filed, shall pay a fee equal to the amount of the transaction for which such report was required to be filed.
